intro: Coccoloba rugosa, commonly known as the rough coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found growing along stream banks and in wetlands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various organisms. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in some regions as a decorative plant.
